On Thu, 2003-07-24 at 19:15, J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
> For some odd reason I don't like setting expectations on an object then letting it verify itself. Sounds weird. I prefer to be the one to verify it. I don't know why.

I agree. I have been mocking for some 5 years now (in our group we
originally called them crash test dummies). I much prefer to query the
mock object and assert whether the 'correct' thing happened in the unit
test. We sell a dynamic mock object implementation that works for
non-final classes and interfaces using byte code modification, that we
call 'imposter'.

You can also download a GPL code coverage tool from us too.

Regards,
Peter.
